trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when attempting to apply an operator to incompatible operands when you evaluate a rule.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleEvaluationIncompatibleTypesException"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleEvaluationIncompatibleTypesException"></xref> with a specified error message.
This constructor initializes the <xref:System.ArgumentException.Message%2A> property of the new instance using the message parameter.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of Exception.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|A null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The error message string.|
A <xref uid="langword_csharp_string" name="string" href=""></xref> that contains the error message to associate with this instance.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleEvaluationIncompatibleTypesException"></xref> class with serialized data.
This constructor is called during de-serialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext> that contains contextual information about the source or destination.
serializeInfo is a null reference (Visual Basic ).
The class name is a null reference (Visual Basic <xref uid="langword_csharp_Nothing" name="Nothing" href=""></xref>) or the <xref:System.Exception.HResult*> is zero.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleEvaluationIncompatibleTypesException"></xref> class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner <xref:System.Exception> that is the cause of this <xref:System.Exception>.

An <xref:System.Exception> that is thrown as a direct result of a previous <xref:System.Exception> should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
A message that describes the current exception.
The <xref:System.Exception> instance that caused the current exception.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleEvaluationIncompatibleTypesException"></xref> class with the details of the compatibility violation.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of Exception represented by this class.

|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|A null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The value of the argument `message`| |<xref:System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleEvaluationIncompatibleTypesException.Left%2A>|The value of the argument `left.`| |<xref:System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleEvaluationIncompatibleTypesException.Operator%2A>|The value of the argument `op.`| |<xref:System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleEvaluationIncompatibleTypesException.Right%2A>|The value of the argument `right.`|
A message that describes the current <xref:System.Exception> .
The <xref:System.Type> appearing on the left side of the operator.
The <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeBinaryOperatorType"></xref> representing the operator whose compatibility is violated.
The <xref:System.Type> appearing on the right side of the operator.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleEvaluationIncompatibleTypesException"></xref> class with the details of the compatibility violation.
This includes the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException*>.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of Exception represented by this class.

|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|The value of the argument `ex.`| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The value of the argument `message`| |<xref:System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleEvaluationIncompatibleTypesException.Left%2A>|The value of the argument `left.`| |<xref:System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleEvaluationIncompatibleTypesException.Operator%2A>|The value of the argument `op.`| |<xref:System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleEvaluationIncompatibleTypesException.Right%2A>|The value of the argument `right.`|
A message that describes the current <xref:System.Exception> .
The <xref:System.Type> appearing on the left side of the operator.
The <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeBinaryOperatorType"></xref> representing the operator whose compatibility is violated.
The <xref:System.Type> appearing on the right side of the operator.
The <xref:System.Exception> instance that caused the current exception.
Sets the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> with information about the exception.

GetObjectData sets a <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo> with all the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.RuleEvaluationIncompatibleTypesException> object data targeted for serialization.
During de-serialization, this exception is reconstituted from the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo> transmitted over the stream.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext> that contains contextual information about the source or destination.
Gets or sets the <xref:System.Type> of the left argument of the expression causing the exception.
The <xref:System.Type> of the left argument of the expression causing the exception.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeBinaryOperatorType"></xref> representing the operator which caused the exception.
The <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeBinaryOperatorType"></xref> representing the operator which caused the exception.
Gets or sets the <xref:System.Type> of the right argument of the expression causing the exception.
The <xref:System.Type> of the right argument of the expression causing the exception.
